intro: Quercus ragnal, commonly known as the Ragnal oak, is a deciduous tree native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its acorns are edible and serve as a food source for various wildlife species. Quercus ragnal is often found in mixed forests and can thrive in a range of soil types.
